I think not and I certainly hope not. If Biden is president, he will need Pelosi exactly where she is now. I also cannot imagine why she would want the job. It is not as powerful as what she has. Being a heartbeat from the Presidency is not enough to make it an attractive challenge to a lot of people. Ultimately, Pelosi would have to feel that she could be replaced by someone currently in the House who is as capable, tough, ethical and politically astute as she is. A quick look at her immediate colleagues does not turn up a single candidate that I can name with confidence. Finally, i think losing Pelosi would result in a free for all brawl as to who would succeed her at a time when the House is very likely to have to deal with some extremely difficult legislation about voting, the COVID-19 pandemic, a severe downturn in the economy, and a fight over the budget and the debt limit — just to name a few.
